radiographyCalculator.invalidInputMessage: Invalid input values. Please check your inputs.

formulas.title: Formulas Used in Calculations
formulas.T_desc_doseRate: Resulting Dose Rate at the calculation point (mSv/h or µSv/h).
formulas.d_desc_doseRate: Distance from the source (meters) to the calculation point.
formulas.X_desc_doseRate: Thickness of the shielding material (meters) between the source and the calculation point.
formulas.Gamma_desc: Isotope-specific Gamma Ray Constant (e.g., 0.13 for ¹⁹²Ir, 0.054 for ⁷⁵Se).
formulas.A_desc: Activity of the radioactive source in Gigabecquerels (GBq). (Converted from Ci).
formulas.factor1000_desc: Unit conversion factor (implicit in constants to obtain µSv/h if activity is in GBq, Γ in its typical units, and d in m).
formulas.e_desc: Euler's number, base of the natural logarithm (approx. 2.71828).
formulas.mu_desc: Linear attenuation coefficient of the shielding material (converted to m⁻¹ for calculation).
formulas.X_desc_distance: Thickness of the shielding material in meters (m). (Entered by the user in mm and converted).
formulas.T_desc: Target Dose Rate in millisieverts per hour (mSv/h). (Converted from µSv/h).
formulas.Y_desc: Numerical value of the collimator effect (dimensionless).
formulas.Xm_desc: Thickness of the shielding material in meters (m). (Final result presented in mm).
formulas.sameAsAbove: Same definitions as in the previous formula.
formulas.d_desc_thickness: Distance in meters (m) at which the Dose Rate T must be achieved. (Entered by the user).
formulas.noteUnits: Note: Units are converted internally to ensure consistency in calculations (e.g., Ci to GBq, cm⁻¹ to m⁻¹, mm to m).
